newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland's Krakow to place PLN 15 mln bond by Dec 20.
newsitem.headline: Poland's Krakow to place PLN 15 mln bond by Dec 20.

text.p: Poland's southern municipality of Krakow plans to place its planned 15-million-zloty floating five-year bond by December 20, the issue's co-manager said in a statement on Thursday.

Bank Wspolpracy Regionalnej (BWR), which will jointly manage the issue with Bank Przemyslowo-Handlowy SA (BPH) and Bank Pekao SA, said that by November 26 the consortium would put forward firm offers to selected investors.
"By December the Krakow municipal bonds will be allotted to investors," BWR said.
The city council has said the bonds would be offered through private placement at or above par.

Each bond with a par value of 10,000 zlotys would pay an annual coupon equal to the mean average of the yields of the benchmark 52-week T-bill sold at four treasury auctions prior to the coupon payment date.
The city plans to use the proceeds from the bond issue to modernise its public transport system.
